item.description:
- First, you will authenticate using an Sage Active user.
    
- Then, you will request the list of organizations authorized for this user.
    
    - This can be either the list of organizations from the most recent to the oldest
        
    - or the list of organizations filtered by the beginning of a name you can specify.
        

Automatically, the environment variables **X-OrganizationId**, **X-TenantId**, and **LegislationCode** will be set with the values of the first organization returned.

You can also choose another organisation from the list and manually set these three variables by copying each of the three values and assigning them to their respective environment variables.

item.name: Discover FILTERS, SORTING, PAGINATION Query Samples
eq Q.journalTypes type = PURCHASE or code = different values
neq Q.journalTypes type <> PURCHASE and code <> different values
startsWith Q.accountingAccounts filtered by code starts with different values
nstartsWith Q.accountingAccounts filtered by code not start  with different values
endsWith Q.customers that have contacts with email ends with .fr, .es or .de
nendsWith Q.customers that have contacts with email not ends with .fr, .es and .de
contains Q.accountingAccounts filtered by name containing 'immo' or 'inmo'
ncontains Q.accountingAccounts filtered by name not  containing 'immo' or 'inmo'
eq Q.accountingAccounts 50 first, with Tax Code equal null, sort by code
neq Q.accountingAccounts 50 first, with Tax Code not equal null, sort by code
in Q.accountingEntries with a debit line equal to 1000 or 500
nin Q.accountingEntries debit not equal to 1000 and 500
Q.accountingAccounts filtered by name containing 'immo' or 'inmo' ordering by Name asc
Q.users filter fullName starts with a, j or b, ordering by fullName asc
Q.accountingEntries third date>=2024-03-01 & <=2024-03-31 ordering by Date desc
Q.accountingAccounts pagination, first 5 {{endCursor / startCursor}} filled in

item.description:
The steps 1 to 5 will allow you to retrieve data necessary for the creation of the accounting entry :

1. a valid date in an open fiscal period,
    
2. a journal code,
    
3. a customer code, and their general ledger account code
    
4. a sales and tax account codes.
    

**You must execute these steps in the specified order** before requesting the creation of the accounting entry.

item.name: Reference : common to all organizations
item.description:
This section specifically discusses resources that are common to all organizations within a single tenant. These resources are:

- Users
    
- Countries
    
- Zip Codes
    
- Document Types

graphql.query:
query($input: AccountingTrialBalanceGLDtoInput!) {
  accountingTrialBalance(input: $input) {
    accountCode
    accountDescription
    accountType
    accumulatedBalance
    accumulatedCreditAmount
    accumulatedCreditBalance
    accumulatedDebitAmount
    accumulatedDebitBalance
    balance
    creditAmount
    creditBalance
    debitAmount
    debitBalance
  }
}

item.name: 1- Q.accountingExercises - most recently opened, startDate filled in {{dateInFirstExercice}}

graphql.query:
query($input: AccountingThirdPartyBalanceGLDtoInput!) {
  accountingThirdPartyBalance(input: $input) {
    thirdPartyDescription
    thirdPartyId
    accumulatedBalance
    accumulatedCreditAmount
    accumulatedCreditBalance
    accumulatedDebitAmount
    accumulatedDebitBalance
    balance
    creditAmount
    creditBalance
    debitAmount
    debitBalance
  }
}

item.description:
This section is dedicated to the accounting resources managed within the context of an organization. Accounting is the backbone of financial management and compliance in an organization.  
The resources described under this chapter are critical for various accounting operations such as general ledger management, tax calculation, and accounting entries.EndFragment

item.description:
The **ProductPrice** service is designed to provide detailed pricing and discount information for a product.  
This pricing and discounting information is calculated based on a variety of rules and parameters, ensuring the most accurate and tailored result for your specific needs.  
The service returns both the calculated discount and price for the product.

Examples of usage include:

1. Calling the price service for a **customer**.
    
2. Calling the price service for a lead where the **country is national** (equivalent to `legislationCode`).
    
3. Calling the price service for a lead where the **country is within the VIES** (VAT Information Exchange System) but not national.
    
4. Calling the price service for a lead where the **country does not fall into the aforementioned categories**.

item.description:
This section outlines the foundational role of Products in the scope of sales transactions.  
Products serve as the foundational elements for creating and managing sales transactions. The Products entity is pivotal in creating and managing Sales Quotes, Sales Orders, Sales Delivery Notes, and Sales

item.name: 11-  M.PurchaseOpenItemSettlement  - Partially pay the first due date.

item.description:
The example shows how to create and close an invoice, then validate (post) it, how to retrieve the due dates, their status, and their amounts, and then partially pay the first due date.

You will need:

1. At least one customer
2. At least two products 
3. A sales invoice created for the customer  
5. A sales journal
6. A payment method set up for transactions

graphql.query:
query ($id : UUID!) {
  salesQuotes (where : { id : { eq : $id }}) {
    edges {
      node {
        id
        customerId
        documentDate
        operationalNumber
        salesDiscountGroupId
        salesTariffId
        socialName
        status
        totalGross
        totalLiquid
        totalNet
        totalVat
        deliveryAddress{
            city
            countryId
            countryName
            firstLine
            province
            secondLine
            zipCode
        }
        mainAddress{
            city
            countryId
            countryName
            firstLine
            name
            province
            secondLine
            zipCode           
        }
        lines{
            id
            firstDiscount
            pendingQuantity
            productCode
            productId
            productName
            status
            totalNet
            totalQuantity
            unitPrice
            vatPercentage            
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

item.description:

2. At least two products
    

For the example of modifying the quote, we start from the created quote.

- We modify the quantity of the first line,
- delete the second line,
- and add a new line with the same product as the first line.

item.description:
### DocumentPdfEmail Service

The DocumentPdfEmail service facilitates the sending of documents in PDF format via email directly through the API. This service simplifies the process of dispatching PDF documents to designated recipients, complete with options for CC and BCC.

#### Important:

- The sender of the email must be the current Sage Active user. Hence, in the example, the user's email is retrieved via `userProfile`.
    
- Replace `emailTo` and/or `emailCC` in the variables with email addresses that will allow you to receive the email, such as your personal email address.

exec: console.log("'currentId' environment variable has been created : " + pm.environment.get("currentId"));

graphql.query:
query ($id : UUID!) {
  salesQuotes (where : { id : { eq : $id }}) {
    edges {
      node {
        id
        customerId
        documentDate
        operationalNumber
        salesDiscountGroupId
        salesTariffId
        socialName
        status
        totalGross
        totalLiquid
        totalNet
        totalVat
        deliveryAddress{
            city
            countryId
            countryName
            firstLine
            province
            secondLine
            zipCode
        }
        mainAddress{
            city
            countryId
            countryName
            firstLine
            name
            province
            secondLine
            zipCode           
        }
        lines{
            id
            firstDiscount
            pendingQuantity
            productCode
            productId
            productName
            status
            totalNet
            totalQuantity
            unitPrice
            vatPercentage            
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

item.description:
Two examples of quote creation:

- A quote for an **existing customer** in Sage Active.
- A quote for a **lead**, meaning a customer not yet existing in Sage Active.

item.description:
The example shows how to create and close an invoice, then validate (post) it, how to retrieve the due dates, their status, and their amounts, and then partially pay the first due date.

You will need:

1. At least one customer
2. At least two products 
3. A sales invoice created for the customer  
5. A sales journal
6. A payment method set up for transactions

item.description:
Example of credit note generation:

- Generating a credit note from a Closed or Posted invoice that does not yet have a credit note.
    

The example

1. retrieves the most recent invoice that is not in "**`Pending`**" status and has `hasCreditNote=false`.
    
2. It then generates a credit note.
    
3. Finally, It allows to read the credit Note with the linked invoice information.
    

**Attention:**  
If the initial query returns no records, you will need to validate an invoice in Sage Active so that its status is set to Closed or Posted.

query ($id : UUID!) {
  salesInvoices (where : { id : { eq : $id }}) {

        operationalNumber
        salesOrderNumber
        salesDiscountGroupId
        salesTariffId
        socialName

            secondLine
            zipCode
        }

            city
            countryId
            countryName
            firstLine
            name
            province
            secondLine
            zipCode           
        }
        lines{
            id
            firstDiscount

            totalQuantity
            unitPrice

      }

  }
}

item.description:
Example of invoice creation:

- An invoice for an existing customer in Sage Active.
    

Note that, unlike quotes which allow for inputting leads, an invoice must **always** be associated with an **existing customer**.

This section outlines various types of sales documents that are essential to the sales process.

  
These include:

- Quotes,
    
- Orders,
    
- Delivery Notes,
    
- and Invoices.
    

Each type of document holds specific information and serves unique purposes.

This section particularly addresses resources that are specific to an organization within a single tenant.

When interacting with such resources via the Sage Active Public API V1, its crucial to specify the organization context by including`X-OrganizationId`in the request header.

exec: // Due to the fact that examples of queries and mutations use URLs in the format {{baseAddress}}/graphql,
// it is necessary to remove the trailing '/graphql' from the {{baseAddress}} environment variable if present.
